result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas A. Noble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
May be served under the Huber Law as long as the defendant reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 20CF219 and any other sentence currently being served.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 20CF2019 and any other sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to successfully complete Treatment Court Program and complete any other conditions deemed appropriate by the agent.
To be paid during terms of probation

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas A. Noble

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 11:08 AM Defendant Lucas A. Noble in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Lucas A. Noble.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. No Contest plea entered on count 1. Defendant advised of U.S. non-citizen collateral consequences resulting in deportation, the exclusion of admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law. Defendant advised of voting rights. Defendant advised of firearm restriction. The Court finds the defendant guilty of count 1. Count 2 to be dismissed and read in. The Court to withhold sentence and place the defendant on probation for 24 months. Defendant to successfully complete Green County Treatment Court as a condition of probation. 1 year conditional jail imposed and stayed. Defendant advised of post conviction relief.
Clerk emailed JOC to court info at GCSD
